isis.stitle: FRONT NON-DRIVE STEERING AXLE: ROCKWELL - ASSEMBLE - KNUCKLE

item.para: Clean the bores of the knuckle and the axle beam.
Put the knuckle on the axle beam.
Install the seal on the thrust bearing.
On `cover' type seals, install the seal over the open end of the bearing ( Figure 26).
On `flat'-type seals, put the seal over the closed part of the bearing ( Figure 26).

svcsubproc.title: Integral Thrust Bearing and Seal
svcsubproc.para: The one-piece thrust bearing with an integrated grease seal is completely interchangeable with the two-piece design. It has a specified top and bottom orientation:

item.para: The surface with the inner diameter seal must be on top.
The surface with the outer diameter seal must be on the bottom ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Outer Diameter Seal on Bottom

step1.para: Slide the seal and thrust bearing assembly between the bottom of the axle beam and the knuckle. Make sure the seal is toward the beam ( Figure 28).

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, wear gloves when installing shims. The shims have sharp edges.

step1.para: Install the shims according to the following procedure:

step2.para: Inspect the shims. Replace damaged shims.
If a new shim pack must be deter- mined, select the amount of shims that will give the smallest end play.
Put a pry bar between the steering arm boss and the axle beam. Lift the knuckle and slide the shim pack between the top of the beam and the knuckle ( Figure 29).
Make sure all the bores are aligned. If the bores are not aligned, the parts will be damaged when the king pin is installed.

step1.para: Install the king pin according to the following procedure ( Figure 30).

step2.para: Apply the lubricant to the bottom half of the king pin. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the pin in the top of the knuckle. Make sure the word "TOP" is toward you.
Rotate the pin so that the slots are aligned with the holes in the knuckle.

caution.para: Do not force the pin through the top bushing or the shims will be damaged.

step2.para: Push the pin through the top bushing, the seal and the shim pack. If the pin is difficult to install, make sure the parts are aligned.

warning.para: Wear eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause serious personal injury.

step2.para: Push the pin into the bottom bushing. If necessary, use a brass hammer to drive the pin into the bushing. Make sure all parts are aligned.
Make sure the slots in the pin are aligned with the holes in the axle beam.

note.para: Do not drive or tighten the draw keys into the knuckle until the end play is checked and adjusted.
All models covered in this service manual section use threaded draw keys.

step1.para: Install the top draw key in the front of the knuckle. Install the bottom draw key in the back of the knuckle. Make sure the key goes through the slot in the pin ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Installing the Top Draw Key

step1.para: Check the end play of the knuckle according to the following procedure:

step2.para: Hit the boss of the knuckle with a rubber mallet to move the parts in position ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Hit the Boss of the Knuckle

step2.para: Turn the knuckle to the straight (forward) position.
Attach a dial indicator. Put the base on the knuckle. Put the tip on the center of the king pin. Set the dial indicator on zero (0) ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Set Dial Indicator on Zero

step2.para: Use one of the following methods to measure the end play.

step3.para: Method 1. Put a pry bar between the knuckle and the top of the axle center. Push the knuckle up and measure the end play ( Figure 34).

warning.para: If a hydraulic jack is used to measure end play, use two safety stands to support the axle. If safety stands are not used, the axle can fall and cause serious personal injury.

step3.para: Method 2. Put a block of wood and a hydraulic jack under the bottom of the knuckle. Raise the knuckle until the pointer on the dial indicator stops ( Figure 35).

step2.para: Repeat steps C and D with the axle in the full right and full left turn positions.
The end play must be 0.001 to 0.025 inch (0.025 to 0.635mm) in all positions.
If the knuckle binds or zero (0) end play is measured, remove the shims from the shim pack.
If more than 0.025 inch (0.635mm) end play is measured, add shims to the shim pack.

warning.para: Wear eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause serious personal injury.

caution.para: Make sure the draw key is installed completely or the locknut is tightened to the specified torque. If not installed correctly, the knuckle pin and the axle beam will be damaged.

note.para: All models covered in this service manual section use threaded draw keys.

step1.para: Install the lock nut and tighten to 30 to 45 ft-lbs. (41 to 61 N·m) ( Figure 36).
Install new gaskets and the caps on the top and the bottom of the knuckle. Install the bolts and the washers and tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N·m) ( Figure 37).

figure.caption: Figure 37. Installing New Gaskets and Caps

step1.para: Connect the tie rod arm to the knuckle. See the procedure in this section.
Install the brake assembly on the knuckle. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the drum and the wheel and tire assembly.
Lubricate the wheel bearings. Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES, Hubs, Bearings and Seals in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the outer wheel bearing cone in the hub. Install the adjusting nut.
Adjust the wheel bearings. Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES, Hubs, Bearings and Seals in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the cap and the gasket on the hub. Install the bolts and tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N·m).
Lower the vehicle to the ground. Check for correct operation.
Check and adjust the toe-in. Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES, Steering General Information and Front Wheel Alignment in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
